case_title: Deputy Commissioner, SRB, Karachi vs M/s. Byco Terminal Pakistan Limited

accussed_details.name: N/A
allegation: Non-payment of Sindh Sales Tax on taxable services
Failure to e-file sales tax returns

complaint_summary: The appellant alleged that the respondent failed to pay Sindh Sales Tax on taxable services and did not e-file sales tax returns for the tax periods from July 2011 to June 2013.
investigation_summary: The appellant's tax profile revealed revenue of Rs.211,882,087 from taxable services, with Sindh Sales Tax liability of Rs.33,901,133. A show-cause notice was issued on 2014-04-19, and the respondent claimed partial payment of Rs.396,703 under an Amnesty Scheme and argued that certain services were non-taxable.
judgment_summary: The court dismissed the appeal, maintaining the Commissioner (Appeals)' decision that the services provided by the respondent were not taxable under the Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011, as they were not listed in the First or Second Schedule of the Act. The tribunal relied on precedents like the APM Terminal case and clarified that renting of immovable property does not constitute economic activity under the Act.
legal_arguments: Prosecution argued that services under Tariff Heading 9809.0000 were taxable and supported by a clarification issued by SRB.
Defense argued that services provided were non-taxable, citing the APM Terminal case and contending that storage and rental services are not taxable under the Act.
statutes: Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011
key_issues: Proper classification of services under the Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011

maxims.Economic Activity: Renting of immovable property does not constitute economic activity under the Act.

legal_terms.Contractual Execution of Work: Defined as physical and mental exertion to attain an end, involving service of labor and transfer of goods.

summary_vector_notes: The case involved the classification of services provided by the respondent under the Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011. The court upheld the Commissioner (Appeals)' decision that the services were non-taxable, relying on prior tribunal decisions and legal definitions of taxable services.

facts.taxable_services: Contractual Execution of Work or Furnishing Supplies under Tariff Heading 9809.0000
facts.non_compliance: No sales tax deposited or returns filed

tariff_heading_9809.0000.components_required: Contractual execution of work and furnishing supplies
tariff_heading_9809.0000.exemption_conditions: Value of services not exceeding Rs.50 million annually

high_court_ruling.case: Younus (Private) Limited vs Government of Sindh
high_court_ruling.finding: Renting of immovable property not taxable under the Act
